title: Junior Salesman
description: Dwight gets to hire a new salesman to replace Jim when he is at his other job. But will he promote Clark or go with one of his unqualified friends instead?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey Brian, you got a sec?

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Yeah, hold on a sec.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I feel awful.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: It's fine. It was my first slip up in nine years of miking you. [phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [in background] Dunder Mifflin, this is Erin.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, thanks for being a good friend.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Sure, anytime. Uh, how about you and Jim? Everything squared away?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, mostly.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Pam, phone call.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, hey, say Hi to Alyssa.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Will do.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey, boom guy.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Oh, hey Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: When are you gonna boom me?

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Uh, listen, they're cracking down on us talking to the subjects. It's a lame rule, but, you know, I wanna... I, I'll see you later.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Got it.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Hey, so I hear you're bringing in some people to interview for the sales job?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's right, a couple of old friends. Ballers only. Must be this cool to ride.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Well, uh... see, you raised it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, did I? Oh, yes, I did.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wallace is letting me hire a junior sales associate to sit at Jim's desk while he's away in Philly. Finally I'll have someone at my desk clump who gets me. It's like, "Really, Jim? You don't understand the difference between a slaughterhouse and a rendering plant? Uh, remind me not to lend you any dead cows or horses." Wow.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: You know what, man? I deserve this job.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: I scored Stone and Son Suit Warehouse with you, and God knows, to get the Scranton White Pages with Jan, I went above and beyond... and under.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what? You're gonna get your interview, okay? I know that you're going head-to-head against some real superstars, but you got a really good chance.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Clark has no chance. I mean, he's up against my buddy Rolf, for God's sake. Guy goes fishing with hand grenades. And Trevor - he'll make you laugh so hard, you'll puke your pants.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: This sucks, you know? You put in 12 grueling weeks at a company, and what do they do? They make you compete for a promotion, like an animal. You know, I thought this was an office, not the Thunderdome.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Big changes coming to the old desk clump. No longer a Pam-Jim alliance against Dwight. Now it is Dwight and a friend axis against Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You could've just called that an alliance too, right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I chose my words very carefully.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Things are a little delicate with me and Pam right now. And if my working in Philly is gonna end up doubling the Dwight in her life, that's only gonna make things worse.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: [sighs] You interviewing for the sales job too?

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: No. You're interviewing for it. I'm getting it.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Well, I wouldn't be so sure about that. I mean, I've been working here 12 weeks. That's a full season of Homeland. A ton of things can happen in that amount of time, as we've seen.

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: I'm Rolf. Rolf Ahl.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Rolf Ahl? Sounds kinda like Roald Dahl.

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: Go to hell.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: There he is.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey. Come on, buddy. Let's do this. Sorry, Rolf goes first.  You don't compare. When you're with the R-O-L-F, you're literally Rolling on the Laughing Floor. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Rolf is my best friend, and he is the man. Cool, calm, and collected 24/7. Just try and rattle Rolf. I dare you. Such a sweet guy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: When are you talking to David Wallace?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm talking to him this afternoon, but don't get your hopes up.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Too late. My hopes are up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Last week, my company in Philly lost a big investor, so we're scrambling to find new funding. Luckily, my partners have a fix - me asking the boss of the company I'm abandoning to give us a gigantic influx of cash.  So... problem solved. Thanks, guys.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And this chair's gonna be yours. And this desk. Ha!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm on the phone. I'm on the phone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No doy!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm just gonna call you back. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Dwight knocking on desk]

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: I hope you like Norwegian black metal, because I don't do earbuds.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [laughs] No earbuds! [both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm sure he's just nervous.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [sighs] It's fine. It's just a seating arrangement. Doesn't matter.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So I've got your resume here, but it's not telling me everything.

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: Well, a lot of that information is private. How do I know you're qualified to evaluate me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, I'm the one offering the job.

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: What are your credentials?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I've worked here for 12 years. I won salesman of the year. I'm an Assistant to the Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: I think I've heard everything I need to hear.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, wait, wait, no, I mean, if you need to know more, you can call David Wallace. I'm sure he'd give a reference.

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: Thank you, Dwight. I'll be in touch.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, they can't all be winners. But Trevor's next and he's a real professional. You say, "Jump," and he says, "Oh who?" He loves to jump on people, that Trevor.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What makes you think you'd be an effective paper salesman?

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.text: Ooh, okay. Didn't see that one coming. Can I take a 20 on that? Maybe we can circle back around to it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, it's a pretty basic question for a potential paper salesman.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.text: Pass. Next one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All right. Do you see yourself as more of a team player or a self-starter?

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.text: No, no and no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There were only two options.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.text: Checkmate. You win this one, my friend. Do you validate parking?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is a bus transfer.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.text: [chuckles] Nothing gets by this guy.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Hey Jim, do you mind if I look over these price sheets before my interview?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure, yeah, go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Thanks, dude. You--you sure it's okay? 'Cause you're kinda--

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, absolutely.  Do people like sitting next to you? You're clean, right?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Oh, Dove Men.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice. Music. Do you listen to it in earbuds? You don't listen to it at all because we're at work, not a Florence and the Machine concert, so--

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Yeah, could I just have a minute to prepare for this?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure, yeah. Do whatever you need to do.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Thanks, dude.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right after you do one thing for me. I need you to breathe in my face.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I need you to breathe in my face right now.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: [exhales]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are we working with, peppermint or wintergreen?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Wintergreen.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I knew it, I knew it.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Yeah, good nose.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I looked at you coming around, and I said, "Wintergreen."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can't hire Clark. Yeah, he looks like a Schrute, but he thinks like a Halpert and he acts like a Beesly.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, here's one. A customer who ordered enough paper to qualify for a volume discount now wants to return half the stock.  You can't rebate the sales price or credit for future purchases because you brokered the deal for a third party.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: That's just a classic no-win situation.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: So I'd Kobayashi Maru it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damn it! Perfect answer, again.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Think Dwight, think. You have a ream of 16-bond ...

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: You know what, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And anoth--

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: This interview's over, and I get the job. I just Kobayashi Maru'd the whole process.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Yeah. Star Trek rules.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It does, but still no.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Come on, man. I mean, did Trevor do that? Did Rolf do that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, you think they're my only friends? I've got way more friends than that, and they're all better than the losers who work here.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [all murmuring]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: This is not natural.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Just - I don't wanna make assumptions based on people's physical appearances.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, of course not, but does physical appearance include smell?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: They smell so bad.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: If I ever get that bad, you'd tell me, right?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Meredith, I tell you all the time.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [chuckles] Walked right into that one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Next up, my cousin Mose. Mose could make a great paper salesman. He's got a natural fear of paper, which would motivate him to get as much of it out of this office as possible. I've got big expectations, Mose-wise.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What quality would make you a good sales associate?

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: People person.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It says here on your resume that you spent the last 15 years as a sales rep for Dow Chemical.

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: That's right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know we live together, right?

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And I've never seen you go to work, ever.

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So why is this on your resume? [door slams]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: So how'd you guys hear about the position?

quotes.speaker: Gabor
quotes.text: My--my mom.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Dwight called my house, but he didn't realize that I had already moved out, because my mom and I are quarrelling because I- I can't stay out of her stuff.

quotes.speaker: Zeke
quotes.text: Dwight's my cousin, so I overheard him telling my brother Mose about the job opportunity in the shower.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: You were in the shower or he was in the shower?

quotes.speaker: Zeke
quotes.text: Everyone was in the shower. It's a cow shower, so there's like, a ton of people in there.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: So you guys all know Dwight already?

quotes.speaker: Melvina
quotes.text: I was his babysitter, and then we dated for a while. He was a passionate lover and the sweetest little baby.

quotes.speaker: Gabor
quotes.text: I knew you looked familiar. You used to pick up Dwight from school.

quotes.speaker: Melvina
quotes.text: You went to X-Men school too? [exhales]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: X-Men school?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When I was young, I spent several years at a private school where I was told I would be taught to harness my mutant abilities. Turned out it was a conman copying Charles Xavier's School for Gifted Youngsters from the X-Men comic books. Took me years to figure out that it was a con. Some people never figured it out.

quotes.speaker: Gabor
quotes.text: Oh, I have a few powers. Night hearing. Dogs understand where I point. And our training included picking carrots, scrubbing tubs, sewing imitation Levi's. A lot of telemarketing.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't want to sit near any of those people for the next 20 years. Someone say something.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I said something when they were thinking of hiring Jim. Didn't work then. And now look what he's doing to us.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Yeah, Jim, this is all your fault.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How is it my fault?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Here's an exercise for you, Jim. Imagine there are consequences to your actions. Imagine the whole world does not revolve around this. There are others.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But it's Dwight who's bring in all the weirdos.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah, but Jim, Dwight's a weirdo. We can't blame a weirdo for bringing in weirdos. We can blame a normal for creating a situation where a weirdo was allowed to bring in weirdos.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, I'm the one who has to sit next to this weirdo when Jim's away. I'm in a position where I'm rooting for Nate, and that just feels wrong. [sighs] Forget it.  I need to work on my mural. I have some pointy trees that I need to round off.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [on phone] Hey Jim, I thought our call was for later.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, this is actually about the new sales guy. Uh, Dwight has brought in a bunch of real weirdos. And I was wondering if I could have some input--

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [presses speaker button] This is Dwight Schrute. Who am I speaking to? And don't lie. I can tell if you're lying.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight. It's David.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: David.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Jim says he'd like some say in the hiring process.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really? That's interesting. 'Cause I was thinking that since Jim is only here part time, he might not be as invested in the decision-making process as someone like me who's here every day. And frankly, killing it lately.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I was just thinking that because this person is gonna be sitting at my desk, near my wife--

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Jim, another thing. Since we are gonna have to hire this junior sales associate to cover for you, I am going to have to pay you only for the days that you actually work.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh. Um...

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. I can't say that that's not fair.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sounds fair to me, David.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: And I know we have a call scheduled for later -

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, so we'll just do that later.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. Why not do it now?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yeah. What's up Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh... [clears throat] Well, it's about Athlead. I'm sorry. Does Dwight have to be on this part of the phone call?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'd love to be in the loop, David.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: It's okay. Go ahead, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: There's a very exciting opportunity to be a core investor -

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Okay. Jim, I'm gonna have to stop you right there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, okay. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispers] I'd love to invest.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'd like to give you $100 million. [snickers] [phone ringing]

quotes.speaker: Hide
quotes.text: Why you make trees into bushes? You don't make paper from bushes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hide, they're giving out jobs upstairs. Why don't you go up and get one?

quotes.speaker: Hide
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [hand dryer whirring]

quotes.speaker: Troy
quotes.text: Whoops.

quotes.speaker: Zeke
quotes.text: [patting Darryl's hair] It's dense. Like bread.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, you can't just hire someone 'cause they're your friend.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm not. These people are the best of the best. I find talent an attractive quality in a friend.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: They're freaks, Dwight. All your friends are weirdos and freaks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know who else was a freak? Spider-man. And he was also a hero.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Your friends are like Spider-man, if he had gotten bitten by a spider and then got really into masturbating.

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: Man, how cool is it gonna be when I start working here? Paintball fights at lunch.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mandatory paintball. Uh, wolf, please report to the parking lot for mandatory paintball at lunch.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wolf is hilarious. He has executed me over 100 times at point-blank range. Half of 'em, we were on the same team. Oh my God. How I screamed. Ah, that goof.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sell me this piece of paper. Watch this.

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: Do you want this paper?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I sure do.

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: It's not very good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I will pay you whatever it takes.

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: I think I wanna keep it now. It must be pretty special if you want it so bad.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, you have lots of other pieces of paper that are just like it. So here, just take my money.

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: Stop trying to get my paper buddy. Okay read my lips. It's over.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. Good. That was great. So. Wow. You're still at the 570 number?

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: I am.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. Good, good, good. [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Hide
quotes.text: I have eight years experience selling electronics in Sanyo store in downtown Tokyo. I was a doctor. And I have a business degree from Tokyo University.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This isn't gonna work out.

quotes.speaker: Hide
quotes.text: Thank you. [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nate is a proven entity, but not without his handicaps; hearing, vision, basic cognition. Trevor is great, but I saw no fire in him today. And this is a guy who loves to start fires. Troy is literally one of a kind. He's a goblin, or a hobbit, or a kobold, which is a type of gremlin. And yet I'm hesitant. Why can't I pull the trigger on any of them?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [groaning] No, no, no. I just need to tell them. I just need to tell them. [knock at door]

quotes.speaker: Melvina
quotes.text: Do you need to be changed?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I do that myself now.

quotes.speaker: Melvina
quotes.text: Mm. Are you going to make a decision soon? I've been double-parked for five hours. I'm wondering if I should move my car.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, you've been towed by now. They tow after about 45 minutes.

quotes.speaker: Melvina
quotes.text: Well, the joke's on them. I live right next to the tow yard. All they did was save me some gas.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.text: Hey man, we get how difficult this is. And no matter how you choose, we're still gonna be your friend.

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: Yeah, whether it's me or Troy Underbridge, or Gabor, or Melvina--

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Or none of you [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: Yeah, you'd bring us all down here, put us through the wringer and then choose none of us.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.text: Can you imagine how insulting that would be? The contempt that a person like that would have to have for you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I wish I could hire all of you.

quotes.speaker: Zeke
quotes.text: I could start Monday.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Psst. Jim Jim? [whispering] Jim, turn around. Jim, turn around. Jim, turn around.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ahh, I love staring off in one direction. If I'm not looking south, I'm not livin'.  That's what I always say.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just act natural. [grunts]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And I was thinking it's only fair that you help make this decision since they'll be sitting at your desk next to your wife.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But you know I wouldn't hire any of these all-stars.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aah! God, that sucks! Aah! What are you gonna do? I mean, it's your call.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope. Your friends not turning out to be as great as you thought? Not even Gabor?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I guess I just have higher standards for my work colleagues than for my friends. I just couldn't picture any of them in the old gold and gray.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I knew it. You designed a uniform for Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Summer. Winter. Jungle. Formal.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I for one, was amazed at how qualified everyone was. You?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. Thank you. Amazed.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And I gotta say, this was a tough decision. And we had to go with none of you.

quotes.speaker: Ira
quotes.text: I'm sorry?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? This is such bullcrap!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, you know, Wallace put me in charge, so you have no say.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wow. So much crap. It's just a load of B.C. How could you do this to them?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Too much now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Do we get our resumes back or do you keep them? Because I only have the one, and I have a chili recipe on the back that I really wanna keep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, this is an outrage. Ugh! You know what? This is Jim Halpert's home address, in case you guys wanna toilet paper his house or whatever.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That seems inconsiderate.

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: No. We get it. Thanks so much for the opportunity, Dwight. Don't open any suspicious packages you may receive. No, wait. Do open them. Totally safe.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Guys, it wasn't up to me. Rolf, come on. Guys, it wasn't my choice! I would have hired all of you! Gabor, Gabor.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.text: Well, my day's shot.

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: Yeah, it's that weird hour where it's too late to start a slow roast and too early for a Swanson's.

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: I got it. Paintball.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, that sounds awesome. Can we wait till I get off work?

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.text: [yelling] And what are we supposed to do until then?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: Let's just go, you guys.

quotes.speaker: Rolf
quotes.text: Yeah. No limit on weapons class, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right. I think that went well.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, uh, if you just take a look at this, and then that'll print out--Hey. Meet your new desk mate.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: What's up good lookin'?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, cool. Hey Clark.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Trust me, this is the least of all evils. It took me all day to pull this off, so you should be thrilled, considering.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I guess. I mean, I kinda liked my old desk mate.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. I'm really sorry I told the guys I'd be there for the board meeting.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Of course.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'll call you when I get there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Take care of my wife. I will be back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They say that everyone outgrows their friends at some point in their lives. Well I just outgrew them all in the span of three hours.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Hey, Pam, I'm going to the kitchen. You want anything?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, hey, I'll take a coffee.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry. You gotta be this cool for coffee.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scoffs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight. Wanna haze the new guy?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Who, me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Absolutely, I do. [giggles]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. Okay, here. Okay, so the next time he goes to the bathroom, I'll distract him, you take that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, yeah, I know what to do. Okay. Oh, that's great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [shushes]

quotes.speaker: {Pam} & {Dwight}
quotes.text: [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aah!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Welcome to the club, pig! [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aah!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, it does matter who ends up sitting next to Pam when I'm gone. The people around you are basically who you end up spending your life with. I mean, because of where my desk was, I spent all those years looking at Pam, and I fell in love. So, that stuff matters. Definitely does.
